intro: Sida heterosperma, commonly known as the stinkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, yellowish flowers. It produces two types of seeds, hence its scientific name "heterosperma," meaning "different seeds." Sida heterosperma is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
